entry.title: Wildcards permitted contrary to documentation for some policies
entry.content:
On Linux with Chromium 124.0.6315.0 ToT
Some content setting URL pattern policies claim to not support wildcards, but apparently do via linux test_policy.json
$ grep -E WILDCARD_VALUE.*not components/policy/resources/templates/policy_definitions/ContentSettings/*AllowedFor* ... $ sudo gedit /etc/chromium/policies/managed/test_policy.json { "AutomaticFullscreenAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "WindowManagementAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ],
"ClipboardAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "CookiesAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "FileHandlingAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "ImagesAllowedForUrl": [ "*" ], "InsecureContentAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "JavaScriptAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "JavaScriptJitAllowedForSites": [ "*" ], "KeygenAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "NotificationsAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "PopupsAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "SensorsAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], "WebPrintingAllowedForUrls": [ "*" ], }
chrome://policy reports many "OK" (JSON attached), page info and site settings show "Allowed by your administrator" (screenshots attached), and quick manual testing confirms a couple.
I recall adding "Wildcards, <ph name="WILDCARD_VALUE">*</ph>, are allowed." for WindowManagement*ForUrls policies, based on similar manual experimentation: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/policy/resources/templates/policy_definitions/ContentSettings/WindowManagementAllowedForUrls.yaml#:~:text=Wildcards%2C%20%3Cph%20name%3D%22WILDCARD_VALUE%22%3E*%3C/ph%3E%2C%20are%20allowed.
What's the best practice? Should new per-origin content setting or permission policies allow wildcards? Should we update any existing documentation or resolve any potential enforcement gaps?

entry.title: mac-angle-chromium-try is too flaky
entry.content:
https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try?limit=200
This trybot is too flaky. I'm seeing unrelated CLs like https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/angle/angle/+/5315376 be rejected twice in a row due to different flakes.
Example failures:
webgl2_conformance_gl_passthrough_ganesh_tests on Intel GPU on Mac failed because of: deqp/functional/gles3/fboinvalidate/sub.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22928/overview * Caused by a random GL error causing an assertion failure in the GPU process
webgl_conformance_metal_passthrough_graphite_tests on AMD GPU on Mac Retina failed because of: deqp/data/gles2/shaders/conversions_vector_to_vector.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22854/overview * Caused by a flake in rendering
webgl_conformance_gl_passthrough_ganesh_tests on Intel GPU on Mac failed because of: conformance/more/conformance/quickCheckAPI-B1.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22921/overview * Caused by a renderer process timeout
webgl_conformance_metal_passthrough_ganesh_tests on AMD GPU on Mac Retina failed because of: conformance/glsl/misc/shader-with-non-reserved-words-1-of-8.html conformance/glsl/misc/shader-with-non-reserved-words-2-of-8.html conformance/glsl/misc/shader-with-non-reserved-words-3-of-8.html conformance/glsl/misc/shader-with-non-reserved-words-4-of-8.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22880/overview * Caused by multiple 30-second timeouts (apparently not caused by hung renderers)
webgl2_conformance_metal_passthrough_graphite_tests on Intel GPU on Mac failed because of: conformance/extensions/oes-texture-float-linear.html * https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-angle-chromium-try/22922/overview * Caused by a GPU process crash inside the Metal validation layers
I'm not sure where to begin to get this bot back to an acceptable level of stability. Flakes are happening across Intel/AMD, Ganesh/Graphite, GL/Metal, etc.
Do others have ideas?
My first instinct would be to turn off parallelism within each shard for these Intel-based Macs and see if that improves things.

entry.title: Enable Python formatting in Catapult
entry.content: Currently, Python formatting is inconsistently applied in the Catapult project. In order to improve code readability and unblock use of Python type hinting, we want to enable Python formatting everywhere other than third party code.

entry.title: ☂️ Bring Python type hinting to Catapult
entry.content:
Umbrella bug for bringing Python type hinting to Catapult.
Desing doc is go/catapult-python-type-hinting-dd

entry.title: BookmarkImageFetcher doesn't use PowerBookmarkMeta image
entry.content: When fetching images, if there's PowerBookmarkMeta available then the image there should be used instead of Optimization Guide.

entry.title: Tests are failing: Unexpected Diff (+got, -want):\n+FAIL internals.visiblePlaceholder(input0) should be first line second line. Was .\n-PASS internals.visiblePlacehol...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): Unexpected Diff (+got, -want):\n+FAIL internals.visiblePlaceholder(input0) should be first line second line. Was .\n-PASS internals.visiblePlaceholder(input0) is \"first line second line\"
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://:blink_web_tests/fast/forms/placeholder-stripped.html
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/3a20cef5df0aa3d8ac602c8ea4e12b86
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Tests are failing: dump_accessibility_browsertest_base.cc(492): Value of: matches_expectation\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): dump_accessibility_browsertest_base.cc(492): Value of: matches_expectation\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityEventsTest.AccessibilityEventsAriaComboBoxFocus/All.mac - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityTreeTest.AccessibilityCSSInlinePositionRelative/All.blink - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityEventsTest.AccessibilityEventsAriaBusyChanged/All.mac - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityEventsTest.AccessibilityEventsAriaComboBoxNext/All.mac - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityEventsTest.AccessibilityEventsAriaComboBoxExpand/All.mac
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/1b8db1d24f0480716a3a105a4cfe0f38

entry.title: Fix broken app icons on chrome://apps due to CSP policy
entry.content: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5293074 introduced stricter CSP policies that do not take chrome://app-icon URLs into account, breaking all app icons on chrome://apps and chrome://app-settings/ page. Fix that by overriding the content security policy for images.

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: OS-level audio controls only mute the last active tab
entry.content:
When multiple tabs are open playing music (e.g. open.spotify.com and youtube.com), OS level audio controls to mute sound on macOS and Windows only affect the last active tab with audio, leaving previous tabs still playing.
Mac screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/iV5QYmSiichyUgU.png Win screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/47p83JhDb9LNrwj.png

entry.title: ICU update script is no longer valid
entry.content:
To roll ICU, there is an [update script](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/icu/scripts/update.sh) that uses SVN to fetch the upstream ICU library from github.
Github has deprecated SVN on 1/8/2024. https://github.blog/2023-01-20-sunsetting-subversion-support/ which breaks the update script.

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: unable to change folder name after creating new folder in side panel
entry.content:
Click Chromenu --> Click show all bookmarks --> click edit --> select a bookmark --> click move --> click new folder --> is there a way to change the folder's name when you create a new folder?
Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9vs5HNgWrhGjvFD
Assigning to Aina to investigate further and provide a spec if necessary.

entry.title: Can android-internal-dbg or android-internal-rel run base_unittests?
entry.content: While trying to repro a CI bot test failure, I found that there's no CQ bot with a matching config to run the test in question (JniByteBuffer.ConversionFromNonBuffer) since it's part of base_unittests.

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: Smoother animations during pinch-to-zoom
entry.content:
Possible to support nicer easing/overall animation when zooming in/out? Especially for trackpad users. Zooming today feels really janky and stuttery. Users should be able to quickly pinch on the trackpad to zoom without the animation failing and zoom event not happening. Compare to Safari where this is done well.
Erik, could you help route to the right owner to investigate further? Also, wasn't sure which component to use so please update that if needed. Thanks!

entry.title: Chrome for Testing uses Chromium policy path on Windows instead CfT specific one
entry.content: https://crrev.com/c/5008236 introduced Chrome for Testing specific policy path that is different from both Chrome and Chromium, however, that change only affects Linux build while the Windows CfT build still uses Chromium policy path in registry.

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: Line-spacing of title and subtitle of tab hover cards is a little tight
entry.content: Either the line-height of the title text should be tighter, or there should be a few more pixels of extra space between the title and the origin. Assigning to Shane to investigate further and provide a spec, if necessary.

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: extensions title cut off strangely when the version number is very long
entry.content:
When managing extensions and viewing in developer mode, the item version is very long and cuts off the title of the extension instead of truncating the version number in favor for the name.
Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8MFbHzioSooSnwX
Assigning to Courtney to investigate and propose a solution, if needed.

entry.title: Tests are failing: java.lang.RuntimeException: Waited for the root of the view hierarchy to have window focus and not request layout for 10 seconds. If you specified ...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): java.lang.RuntimeException: Waited for the root of the view hierarchy to have window focus and not request layout for 10 seconds. If you specified a non default root matcher, it may be picking a root that never takes focus. Root:
Root{application-window-token=android.view.ViewRootImpl$W@75c8ebc, window-token=android.view.ViewRootImpl$W@75c8ebc, has-window-focus=false, layout-params-type=1, layout-params-string={(0,0)(fillxfill) sim={forwardNavigation} ty=BASE_APPLICATION wanim=0x10302fe
 fl=LAYOUT_IN_SCREEN LAYOUT_INSET_DECOR SPLIT_TOUCH HARDWARE_ACCELERATED DRAWS_SYSTEM_BAR_BACKGROUNDS
 pfl=NO_MOVE_ANIMATION FORCE_DRAW_STATUS_BAR_BACKGROUND FIT_INSETS_CONTROLLED
 bhv=DEFAULT
 fitSides=}, decor-view-string=DecorView{id=-1, visibility=VISIBLE, width=1768, height=2208, has-focus=false, has-focusable=false, has-window-focus=false, is-clickable=false, is-enabled=true, is-focused=false, is-focusable=false, is-layout-requested=false, is-selected=false, layout-params={(0,0)(fillxfill) sim={forwardNavigation} ...
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.multiwindow.InstanceSwitcherCoordinatorTest#testBackOnConfirmDialog - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.multiwindow.InstanceSwitcherCoordinatorTest#testCloseWindow - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.multiwindow.InstanceSwitcherCoordinatorTest#testNewWindow - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.multiwindow.InstanceSwitcherCoordinatorTest#testSkipCloseConfirmation
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/9b72cf5a8ce6f490aa26b9ea3ca604f7
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Remove FakeGdiInit interceptions under win32k lockdown
entry.content:
FakeGdiInit intercepts windows dll loader and some user32/gdi32 functions so we can load the dlls under win32k lockdown. https://source.chromium.org/search?q=FakeGdiInit%20&sq=&ss=chromium
We don't need to shim Windows to apply win32k lockdown as long as we avoid loading these DLLs. Here is a spec draft on what we could do to remove the shims, for commenting: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZlhE7oFA7WR77yBQvtXAhoB-48kobmVTASi2NH1cOyQ/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: login.corp.google.com refused to connect. that is the error I get when I try to report a post
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Click on a thread 3dots 2. Click on report a post 3. Get the error login.corp.google.com refused to connect.
# Problem Description This error seems to be to be regulated to just me. Other PEs do not have the issue. I have removed all extensions, no joy, changed DNS, no joy, cleared DNS cache, cleared chrome cache, rebooted my router several times, tried a a Hotspot, used my android phone , I have also powerwashed and recovered my Chromebook no joy.
# Summary login.corp.google.com refused to connect. that is the error I get when I try to report a post
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug-Regression - Used to work, now broken

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: Top Chrome has two opposite moving progress indicators on Mac
entry.content:
[Mac] On load, top Chrome has two different progress indicators and they're moving in opposite directions. We should pick one direction for both. Assigning to Shane to decide.
Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8u7acfpYBnNUxhz.png

entry.title: Step compile failure issue seen on win trunk of Official Desktop continuous Builders.
entry.content:
Step compile failure issue seen on win trunk of Official Desktop continuous Builders.
Step compile failed. Error logs are shown below: [55437/81682] CXX obj/chrome/browser/browser/configuration_policy_handler_list_factory.obj FAILED: obj/chrome/browser/browser/configuration_policy_handler_list_factory.obj ..\..\buildtools\reclient\rewrapper -cfg=..\..\buildtools\reclient_cfgs\chromium-browser-clang\rewra...(too long) ../../chrome/browser/policy/configuration_policy_handler_list_factory.cc(2020,5): error: no member named 'kWebSQLAccess' in namespace 'policy::key'; did you mean 'storage::kWebSQLAccess'? 2020 | { key::kWebSQLAccess, | ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ | storage::kWebSQLAccess ../..\components/services/storage/public/cpp/storage_prefs.h(12,19): note: 'storage::kWebSQLAccess' declared here ...The message was too long... More information in raw_io.output_text[failure_summary]
Link to builder: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/win/83996/overview
Link to log: https://logs.chromium.org/logs/chrome/buildbucket/cr-buildbucket/8755457831785908097/+/u/compile/stdout
Unable to find the suspect CL. Requesting someone from the Dev team to look into the issue.
Thank you!
Issue summary

entry.title: [2024 PE] Desktop: Windows legacy scrollbar on rendered webpages
entry.content:
On Windows, the legacy scrollbar appears on certain websites or occasions (open side panel) that doesn’t seem to be clipped properly by the parent wrapper. It also doesn’t fit the Chrome Browser look & feel, and looks subpar compared to Edge on Windows 11 devices.
Can we investigate effort required to update?

entry.title: Change visibility of ProtegoPingType from private to public
entry.content:
The SafeBrowsingMetricsCollector's ProtegoPingType has private visibility, which means that every new unit test we add that tests the functionality of the protego ping logging needs to be added as a friend of the metrics collector. By changing the visibility we can make it easier for people to write new tests around this functionality.
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/safe_browsing/core/browser/safe_browsing_metrics_collector.h;l=183-189;drc=c571efbef3ecfe66613d524ff39c58e25d18548c
